definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: They are motivated by the twin color=# cc0066> goads of punishment and reward.
sentences.chinese: 他们受赏与罚的双重因素所激励。

sentences.english: They are motivated by the twin goads of punishment and reward.
sentences.chinese: 他们受赏与罚的双重因素所激励。

sentences.english: He did a bang-up job and deserves a reward.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作干得非常出色，应当受赏。

definition: to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
to confer a title an official position
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
to bestow a prize or reward/an award
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
to report a heroic deed/to mention sb in dispatches
select the best people for promotion
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
